title: Built on AsnycIO
body: TBone is a concurent web framework, build on top of AsyncIO. It is ideal for developing real-time APIs and services which rely on heavy IO-bound operations

title: Web server agnostic
body: TBone is a concurrent web framework built on top of AsyncIO. It can work with any Python server that is built on AsyncIO. TBone comes with full support for Sanic and AioHttp and can easily be extended to support other servers

title: Full-duplex RESTful APIs
body: Build REST-style resources that provide real-time communication between server and client. TBone implements an abstraction layer that is protocol agnostic and allows developers to build RESTful resources even when not working with HTTP

title: Data management. An ODM layer for representing data schema
body: TBone comes with a full object mapper so developers can write Python classes that represent data and have full control over data serialization and de-serialization

title: Data Persistency
body: TBone's data management classes are datastore agnostic. TBone ships with a full implementation of data persistency over MongoDB

title: HTTP and websocket protocols
body: REST resources are protocol agnostic. TBone provides full support for HTTP and websocket protocols. TBone can easily be extended to support other protocols such as AMQP

title: Authentication and Authorization
body: Full support for user authentication and authorization using server-side sessions as well as JWT tokens

title: JavaScript Client Library for Web and Mobile
body: TBone ships with a vanilla-based Javascript library which makes it easy to write client for web and mobile

title: Factory app for scaffolding projects in minutes
body: TBone ships with an optional factory CLI that will generate and scaffold your TBone apps and services based on your requirements
